content.full_text:
William B. Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 1 January 18481 MrGeo FisherofOttawa Illinois, is an applicant for a commission in theArmy. MrF. was a non commissioned officer, in my Battallion, and under my immediate commandforduring ourcampaigninMexico, and I take pleasure in saying, that he is a young man, of education, fine abilities,

unexceptionable in his habits, and one of theverrybest Officers in the Army. He was the life and soul of his company, a company acknowledged,

amongst the best drilld & disciplined in our Column, and if you can forward his views, you may rest satisfied

that you are rendering your country a service, besides doing a favour to2
paragraphs: William B. Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 1 January 18481 MrGeo FisherofOttawa Illinois, is an applicant for a commission in theArmy. MrF. was a non commissioned officer, in my Battallion, and under my immediate commandforduring ourcampaigninMexico, and I take pleasure in saying, that he is a young man, of education, fine abilities,
unexceptionable in his habits, and one of theverrybest Officers in the Army. He was the life and soul of his company, a company acknowledged,
amongst the best drilld & disciplined in our Column, and if you can forward his views, you may rest satisfied
that you are rendering your country a service, besides doing a favour to2

footnotes.text: 1William B. Warren wrote and signed the letter. This letter was enclosed inGeorge S. Fisher to Abraham Lincoln.
2It does not appear that Fisher received a commission.
